page.title: 01LAND SOUTH EAST OF ALRESFORD
page.content: This is an area of mixed farmland, scattered houses and two villages, Bishops Sutton in the North West and Ropley Dean in the North East. The A31 trunk road runs through the villages and the River Arle rises East of Bishops Sutton and Flows West through meadows and watercress beds. The highland to the South of the A31 is farmland with large fields divided by hedges, areas of wood and narrow lanes leading to hamlets and farms. There is a small area of grass common land (Bramdean Common) at the southern edge. Habitation is mainly along the A31 and the road to Petersfield. The buildings are mostly 20th Century but include a few large Georgian and Victorian residences and quite a lot of old cottages. Farming employs a small number of inhabitants, but most travel daily to jobs in nearby towns.
